@CourtsIdle I think the underlying issue is the lack of advocates to do the work. You can build the courts, the prisons, hire those staff, but there are not the lawyers you need to get things through the system any more. That to me is the big change in the last couple of years

@CourtsIdle Not sure who you have in mind here but @BarristerSecret @CrimeSolicitors @lccsa and many individual lawyers have been highlighting the lack of investment in all areas of the CJS for many years now.Over a decade of cuts and this is the result and no one can claim they’re surprised
@CourtsIdle But they can choose cases to expedite.
@CourtsIdle @BarristerSecret One way to solve prison overcrowding I suppose. Like the crime reduction during 2020 Patel was so proud of.
